title: FTSE 100 Reaches 10,000 Points for the First Time
summary: The FTSE 100, which is a list of the 100 biggest companies in the UK stock market, has gone above 10,000 points for the first time. This happened on the first trading day of the year and is a big milestone. Share prices in the index went up a lot in 2025, making it over 21% higher than last year. This is good news for people who have investments like pensions because their money grows. The index includes companies from different sectors like mining and defense, which did well because of higher gold prices and more defense spending. Experts say reaching 10,000 points is important because it shows investors are interested in UK companies again, especially when they worry about high prices in the US tech market. The UK market offers stability with companies that provide essential goods and services.

background_read: The FTSE 100 is an index that tracks the performance of the 100 largest companies listed on the London Stock Exchange. It helps measure how well the UK stock market is doing. When share prices go up, it means companies are valued higher, which can be good for people who invest money, like through pensions. In 2025, the index reached 10,000 points for the first time, showing strong growth. This happened because sectors like mining and defense did well due to factors like higher metal prices and increased global spending. Experts highlight this as a sign that investors are turning to UK companies for stability, especially when other markets like the US tech sector seem risky.
